title: 5 things which could have been written on THAT note Jurgen Klopp gave to Daniel Sturridge
text:
Sport 5 things which could have been written on THAT note Jurgen Klopp gave to Daniel Sturridge Liverpool were well below-par during the EFL Cup semi-final clash at Southampton, and in an attempt to gee them up their manager tried to act... Share Passing notes in class (Photo: EMPICS Sport) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It wasn't to be Liverpool's night in the first leg of their EFL Cup semi-final clash at Southampton, with Nathan Redmond's early goal giving the Saints a 1-0 win . 
Jurgen Klopp's side were well below par throughout the evening, never really getting going and in truth more than a little fortunate that it was only the one goal that they lost by. 
They'll try and put that right in the second leg at Anfield in two weeks' time, as Klopp's efforts to rectify things on Wednesday evening didn't work out. Not even all the shouting and clapping in the world could save Liverpool (Photo: Ian Walton) Daniel Sturridge with the note (Photo: EMPICS Sport) 
In an attempt to gee up his team, the German boss was seen passing a note to Daniel Sturridge via Adam Lallana and Emre Can during the second period, and Twitter immediately began to wonder just what could be on it. 
We think we've got it worked out though. It's one of these five suggestions: Kick it in the goal "Ohhhh. The goal? Gotcha." (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Simple, but Liverpool seemed like they needed it. Trying running around a bit more "Down I go" (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
To be fair, it wasn't just Sturridge who needed telling about this one. Tell Emre to pass to a green , yellow , Toxic Thunder shirt He's probably just given it away (Photo: Reuters) 
Because whatever colour it is, he clearly couldn't see it at St Mary's. You got Sadio's number? The missing Mane (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
Because he's needed back pretty sharpish on this evidence. Do you like my dance? 
Needs a bit of work, just like the second leg will. poll loading
